original_solution_mapping.L1: He is getting an extra 55-20=<<55-20=35>>35 text messages per day
original_solution_mapping.L2: So he is getting an extra 35*7=<<35*7=245>>245 text messages per week

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3286.
    Returns: the number of text messages per week that are not intended for him.
    """
    # L1
    new_texts_per_day = 55 # Now he is getting 55
    old_texts_per_day = 20 # He used to get 20 text messages a day
    extra_texts_per_day = new_texts_per_day - old_texts_per_day

    # L2
    days_per_week = 7 # WK
    extra_texts_per_week = extra_texts_per_day * days_per_week

    # FA
    answer = extra_texts_per_week
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He is getting an extra {new_texts_per_day}-{old_texts_per_day}=<<{new_texts_per_day}-{old_texts_per_day}={extra_texts_per_day}>>{extra_texts_per_day} text messages per day
So he is getting an extra {extra_texts_per_day}*{days_per_week}=<<{extra_texts_per_day}*{days_per_week}={extra_texts_per_week}>>{extra_texts_per_week} text messages per week

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He is getting an extra 55-20=<<55-20=35>>35 text messages per day
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: So he is getting an extra 35*55=<<35*55=1925>>1925 text messages per week

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'new_texts_per_day' (55) was used instead of 'days_per_week' (7).
